---
title: "Manage workflow tasks"
date: last-modified
---

View and interact with workflow transition tasks assigned to your user roles for all workflows on your models.

:::{.callout}
Tasks will only appear in your inbox if the workflow step[^1] is set up to display the action button to your user role.[^2]
:::

::: {.attn}

## Prerequisites

- [x] {{< var link.login >}}
- [x] There are models registered in the model inventory.[^3]
- [x] Model stages have already been customized for use in workflows.[^4]
- [x] Workflows have already been set up for use with your models.[^5]
- [x] You are a assigned role with sufficient permissions to transition the workflow into its next state.[^6]

:::

## View workflow tasks

1. In the left sidebar, click **{{< fa bell >}} Updates**.

2. Select the **Tasks** tab.

3. From the in-{{< var vm.platform >}} task list, view and filter your tasks, access models attached to tasks, and transition model workflows into their next states:

::: {.panel-tabset}

### View and filter tasks

To filter tasks:

a. Click **{{< fa filter >}} Filter** to configure whether or not completed tasks are displayed:

    - Toggle **Show competed tasks** to show completed tasks.
    - Untoggle **Show completed tasks** to hide completed tasks.

b. Click **Apply Filters** to narrow down results based on your selection.

To show older tasks, scroll down to the bottom and click **Load More**.

### Access model details

To view the details of a model attached to a task, click the button displaying the name of the model.

### Transition model workflows

If an action is available to your role, you'll see it appear as an action button under a task:

- Click **{{< fa arrow-right >}}** to open up the transition panel for your selected action. This arrow will be followed by the action name.
- Enter your **[notes]{.smallcaps}** and any other additional inventory fields^[[Manage model inventory fields](/guide/model-inventory/manage-model-inventory-fields.qmd)] then click **Submit**.

Once completed, action buttons will be grayed out.

:::
